sense.name: amount of time that something is postponed
sense.commentary: DELAY[+quantity][+time][+postponement] Note: refers to an amount of unexpected, unintended time
sense.examples: Bad weather in Dallas was causing 2-hour delays at the airport. Sally experienced a long delay in getting her renewed passport. Huge traffic delays at the bridge are now common during rush hour.

sense.name: the act of postponing an event
sense.commentary: DELAY[+action][+postponement][+of_event] Note: X's delay of Y -> X caused Y to be delayed, a nominalization
sense.examples: Congress's delay of bringing this bill to the floor has angered voters. The extremely cold spring resulted in the delay of buds opening this year. I managed to get out the door without further delay.

sense.name: the lag of an electronic signal
sense.examples: Electronic delay has been a critical problem in active noise control systems. There was .5 second delay in the signal transmission.

sense.name: an electronic device that creates a signal lag
sense.examples: With this kit you can build your own electronic delays.
